summary: REQ-10 and REQ-11 appear implemented on the frontend via a gated ProfileSetupDialog that saves the profile and unblocks the app, with an Exit button that clears auth state. REQ-12 appears implemented on the backend with per-caller get/save profile methods keyed by Principal. The diff also adds extra backend profile/admin functionality not explicitly requested.

hallucinated_features.description: Backend exposes an admin/third-party profile lookup method (getUserProfile) beyond the requested caller-only get/save API for onboarding.
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-12 only asks for methods to fetch and update the *callerâ€™s* profile for onboarding completion; the diff adds an additional method that accepts an arbitrary Principal and allows admin access.
evidence: backend/main.mo (adds `public query ({ caller }) func getUserProfile(user : Principal)` with admin check)

hallucinated_features.description: UserProfile schema includes many fields (familyName, company, role, project, team members, customer, onboardingComplete) rather than the minimal 'name' required for onboarding.
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-12 specifies profile data 'at minimum: name'. The diff introduces a broader profile structure and requires saving the full record (frontend fills unused fields with empty values).
evidence: backend/main.mo (defines `public type UserProfile` with multiple fields)
frontend/src/components/auth/ProfileSetupDialog.tsx (constructs full `UserProfile` with blank fields and `onboardingComplete: true`)
